body_html:
Figured it out. I was getting a context has already been set RuntimeError when trying to set the start method to 'spawn'.

Found a buried sklearn import for some f1 computations. Moving the sklearn import inside the actual f1 function call allowed for the start method to be set inside the if __name__=='__main__'.

relevant: http://scikit-learn.org/stable/faq.html#why-do-i-sometime-get-a-crash-freeze-with-n-jobs-1-under-osx-or-linux
body_text:
Figured it out. I was getting a context has already been set RuntimeError when trying to set the start method to 'spawn'.
Found a buried sklearn import for some f1 computations. Moving the sklearn import inside the actual f1 function call allowed for the start method to be set inside the if __name__=='__main__'.
relevant: http://scikit-learn.org/stable/faq.html#why-do-i-sometime-get-a-crash-freeze-with-n-jobs-1-under-osx-or-linux
body:
Figured it out. I was getting a `context has already been set` RuntimeError when trying to set the start method to 'spawn'.  

Found a buried sklearn import for some f1 computations. Moving the sklearn import inside the actual f1 function call allowed for the start method to be set inside the `if __name__=='__main__'`.

relevant: http://scikit-learn.org/stable/faq.html#why-do-i-sometime-get-a-crash-freeze-with-n-jobs-1-under-osx-or-linux
